ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A challenging survey of Nubian archaeology. Be prepared for a lot of reading, some of which is difficult to understand without a background in Egyptology. Overall, an important course to take if you are interested in African archaeology and the role Nubia played in Africa's past.

The Archaeology of Nubia I covers the theories and debates pertaining to the ancient cultures of Nubia from earliest prehistory to the end of the Egyptian Second Intermediate Period. I would cautiously recommend the course to another student interested in the topic as the information is of vital importance, however, I would caution that the student should be prepared to spend a lot of extra time attempting to synthesize the information presented.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was very helpful in broadening my knowledge base in African archaeology. Many of the topics covered gave me new ideas for my future research.
